title: I miss when Riot used to release champions the moment the patch went live.
body:
I thought the point of the PBE was eliminate launch issues and yet, new champs still come much later. I knew that Taliyah wouldn't be available but this line made me think she would be available at launch: Taliyah, the Stone Weaver, will be released in this patch!

Alas, it's not to be as it's obviously a poor choice in wording and clearly should state that she'll be released at a later date.

I just wanted to get in a few days of practice before URF, where I can take her and have some fun. I will be so salty if she's not released in time for URF, as she actually looks like fun on URF.

replies.body:
> this line made me think she would be available at launch: Taliyah, the Stone Weaver, will be released in this patch!

So, if Riot said that we'd get URF in December you'd *assume* it was going to happen at the *start* of December?

Fact is "in this patch" refers to the *entirety* of the patch, not just the start.

> [{quoted}](name=HeartVine,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=ROBI2LxV,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-05-18T04:41:50.351+0000)
>
> So, if Riot said that we'd get URF in December you'd *assume* it was going to happen at the *start* of December?
> 
> Fact is "in this patch" refers to the *entirety* of the patch, not just the start.

The patch isn't something that is rolled out overtime. The moment we patched to version 6.10, the patch was completed. We downloaded and installed the patch that Taliyah _should_ have been released in. As I said, it's poorly worded and phrased.

As for your comparison... that's awful. If Riot stated that we would get URF in December, I would be confused on why they gave no precise date, as they should. But on average, it would mean around the 15th of December, as you should assume the middle -- knowing Riot, it'd be the end of December.

tl;dr: The patch is already _completed_, they're just delaying parts of it for some unknown reason.

It really should say that Taliyah will be activated at a later date, not that she'll be released with the patch.

> The patch isn't something that is rolled out overtime.

Never said it was, but until we reach patch 6.11 we're in patch 6.10. One patch only ends when the next one starts, but that doesn't mean that we don't get the full update when the patch starts.

They did that with Azir and he came out so buggy, particularly his Q, lancers and his ultimate which in some cases would perpetually keep people knock-up.

I think they have learned since then; Riot is not going to rush through the PBE phase of champion release because it can get really bad. Not every niche case is explored when a champion is picked and they're trying to iron out Taliyah before full server(s) release.
They are probably doing this to ENSURE that they do not or barely miss any bugs on the champion. You gotta understand that it requires alot of testing.

> [{quoted}](name=iAkeno,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=ROBI2LxV,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2016-05-18T05:44:22.103+0000)
>
> They are probably doing this to ENSURE that they do not or barely miss any bugs on the champion. You gotta understand that it requires alot of testing.

I forgot that the PBE doesn't exist and it's purpose is to test for bugs.
